Author: rms
Content: Tagging would be an enormous improvement here, it's been a long standing request for reddit, too.

Author: aston
Content: edit: I think there's a certain degree of hype involved.

Author: aston
Content:
If I were LinkedIn, I'd hold off until Facebook IPO's. Rising tide lifts all ships and whatnot.

Until Facebook makes some significant business-friendly changes to their site, I think LinkedIn still has plenty of room to exist and/or grow.

Author: transburgh
Title: When did Facebook and LinkedIn become competitors?

Author: aston
Content:
I think the bigger story is less about computationally hard problems, but about

1) finding a problem being solved the wrong way by the world and setting out to solve it the right way

2) the pains of dealing with all of the proprietary (and often annoying) deals and details in a well-established industry.

PS: It's easy to miss, but the interesting link here is http://www.demarcken.org/carl/papers/ITA-software-travel-com...

Author: jaggederest
Content:
They did! Some rails guys tried to splinter out a prototype at the 11th hour but were convinced not to.

Now we'll never know whether rails would have helped

Author: shiro
Content: I agree that it's silly to have a "programming language" degree.  However, isn't it a basic requirement to be fluent in the language to think in?  English literature major would require fluent English, math major would require fluent to read mathematic notations, etc.  Teaching concepts to those who don't know the language well to describe them seems impossible to me.
